key_mistakes.reason: This move blocks the c1 bishop and is passive, limiting development.
This move misplaces the knight, blocking the d-file and reducing control of the center.
Inaccurate move that misses opportunities for more active play.
Releases central tension prematurely, allowing White to capture with development.
This move unnecessarily retreats the knight, losing tempo and central control.
This move misplaces the rook, making it vulnerable and less effective.
Retreats the bishop passively, reducing its influence on the board.
Fails to capitalize on an opportunity to apply pressure or improve position.
Weakens the pawn structure unnecessarily, creating potential weaknesses.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center with pawns and pieces during the opening.
Try to avoid blocking your own pieces with pawn moves that limit their activity.
Look for opportunities to develop your pieces actively and coordinate them effectively.
Pay attention to pawn structure, avoiding weaknesses that could be exploited.
